Elliotte Harold wrote:

> Basic Agile: You Ain't Going to Need It (YAGNI). Why make the effort to
> create a protected method that more than likely will never be used or
> will be used so rarely it won't even pay back the complexity cost of the
> extra JavaDoc? 

To me, the effort to go from this:

private void foo()

to this:

/** internal: may change */

protected void foo()

seems small enough to allow for some extra consideration.

On a class like TestClassRunner (the focus of the first post in this 
subthread), which is already in an internal package, is very central to 
the implementation, and on which at least two, and soon to be three, 
requests have been made to make private methods protected, there seems 
to be sufficient experience to wonder if some of the others should be 
made protected before future extenders have to ask.

    David Saff
